abstract: A new book predicts that an emphasis on efficiency and real costs will make renewable energy the inevitable replacement for fossil fuels.
snippet: A new book predicts that an emphasis on efficiency and real costs will make renewable energy the inevitable replacement for fossil fuels.
lead_paragraph: Amory B. Lovins, the longtime efficiency guru, has a new book out that analyzes the possibility of converting the nation to almost total reliance on renewable sources of energy. The conclusions may not win instant acceptance, but it is certainly in the running for the best-blurbed energy book of the year.

headline.main: Fossil Fuels as the Whale Oil of the Future
